Description: Fragment of mother-of-pearl shell, with a partially drilled hole.
Curator's comments: Several engraved shells were discovered in Naukratis, including this mother-of-pearl piece that cannot be identified. It is probably from a marine species, rather than a freshwater clam. Other carved examples (but not this one) from Naukratis belong to the class of Tricdana squamosa (see also BM 1886,0401.1594, BM 1886,0401.1596-1597), but also include a large conical shell (1886,0401.1598) Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I., 1884–5 (third memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London, 35-36, Pl. XX, 10-12, 16.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 35, pl. XX, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (WA.13)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.49)
